visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly sales trends using synthetic data with seasonal variation and an upward trajectory
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 monthly observations of sales revenue, representing a univariate time series with categorical temporal indexing. Synthetic data was generated with μ=125.3k and σ=29.8k, incorporating both a 22% annual growth trend and Q2-Q3 seasonality patterns. Values maintain domain consistency through realistic revenue fluctuations and weekend/holiday effects visible in January/December dips. The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines while preserving trend legibility through curved interpolation. Cairo's principles are applied through sequential blue coloring and proportional axis scaling that maintains visual proportionality. The choice of a single series with high contrast against light gray background optimizes pre-attentive processing of the growth trajectory. Annotated statistical anchors (baseline mean, peak/trough values) provide quantitative context without chart junk.
